name: Initial trigger, immediate reset, then 5s delay message IFF not retriggered
Pass array after all 3 parts arrive OR 5sec timeout, then single payload
Pass array after ANY 2 parts arrive
INITIALLY, only pass array after 3 parts arrive. Afterwards, any single input retriggers whole message
Sample Tasmota Format
AzimuthDiagostic
info:
Diagnostic Payload: CSV
magnet status (string) OR magnet strength (integer)
agc level ff
current hysteresis level 00
current offset value 00

Sample MAC 30AEA4070D64

name: Azimuth
info:
Data Payload: CSV
millis = unsigned long integer
azimuth = nnn.n float
degrees per sec = nn.n float

name: Simulated MAC IDs
info:
DEADFEED - sim azimuth
FEEDFACE - sim data packet
D0D0CACA
D0CF1130
FEEDC0DE
B105F00D
8BADF00D

Can be modified to trigger on values within certain range
ie "only if changed by more than 5%"

name: Advanced mustache example
info: Template node can create a string value using [Mustache](http://mustache.github.io/mustache.5.html) syntax.

name: Example: Status Node
info: Status node can catch change of status message of specified nodes or all nodes in a flow.  It receives metadata of status message.

name: Catch status message of 1st debug node
Parse result as JSON
info:
Template node can create a string value using [Mustache](http://mustache.github.io/mustache.5.html) syntax.
If `Partsed JSON` output is selected, the created string is parsed as JSON format and JavaScript object is send as an output payload value.

name: Convert values to a buffer then back again (UI Spec)
Convert values to a buffer then back again (msg.spec)

format:
<md-list>
    <md-list-item ng-repeat="device in msg.payload">
        <md-button class="md-ink-ripple" ng-href="http://{{device.tasmotaname}}" target="_blank">{{device.friendlyname}}
        </md-button>
    </md-list-item>

</md-list>
info:
Original

<md-list>
    <md-list-item ng-repeat="device in msg.payload">
        <md-button class="md-ink-ripple" ng-href="http://{{device.Hostname}}" target="_blank">{{device.Name}}</md-button>
    </md-list-item>
    
</md-list>

name: Write string to a file specied by filename property, the read from the file
info: Write file node can target file using `filename` property.

name: ↓write to file specified by filename property
Specify encoding of written data
info: Write file node can specify encoding of data.

name: Oputputs two values with interval
info:
Outputs 1. Then output 0 after a certain period of time.

*This could be used, for example, to blink an LED attached to a Raspberry Pi GPIO pin.*

name: Set base path
Set 404
ui_temlplate - present download links on dashboard
Create http endpoint <nodered>/files/xxx  where xxx is the file name to download
